summary: The Department of Defense reported that its Defense Travel System processed over $965 million in improper payments—payments that should not have been made or were made in an incorrect amount—to service members and civilian employees in fiscal years 2016 through 2018. The system is designed to reimburse individuals after official travel is completed. DOD has a required plan to prevent and reduce improper travel payments...
title: Defense Travel: DOD Should Strengthen Its Ongoing Actions to Reduce Improper Travel Payments
